name: Antonius Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is a family run affair a few hundred metres from the town centre, up a side road. We spent a week there and found the family to be friendly and helpful. Our room was pleasant, clean and had all the necessities.
reviews.title: A little overpriced for just a Family Pension but friendly proprietors

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, the atmosphere of the place was really one for older people. Very quiet, lights out early type of atmosphere. No music or drinking or what I call après-ski. For that we had to venture into town.
reviews.title: A Very Good Hotel

reviews.text: The location is close to slopes, but it’s a bit of scramble along snowy paths to join a piste, so not the easiest by far. You could ski back to fairly close to the hotel, but again it’s not right on the pistes.
reviews.title: Another great skiing holiday in Lech

reviews.text: The food was a little disappointing. Only occasionally was there any choice on the evening meal, the quantities were small and quality was very basic for the price. There was far too much cream and dairy in the diet, while good quality meat or fish was rarely present. Breakfast buffet was quite meagre in choice, while the salad bar in the evening had the least variety I have ever seen in an Alpine hotel.
reviews.title: 1st Time to Lech
Faultless
reviews.text: The hotel caters for a lot of UK skiers from package tour companies, again mainly an older set, no doubt at bargain rates, but when you book directly the costs are much higher.

description: Located in an ideal central position the cozy and elegant Hotel Antonius is situated just 200m from the skilifts, skischool and the village center. Skiing is possible right to the doorstep.The hotel presents a high standard of comfort and personal service in a homely inviting atmosphere and is well-run by the charming and accommodation Family Strolz.
